text: Bottle shared. Pours deep dark red, still. Aromas of sweet cherries, vanilla, chocolate, tannins, dark fruits, chili fruitiness. Taste is sweet, lots of cherries, smoky, chili fruitiness, light heat, caramel, vanilla.
Sample from bottle. Pours still light murky, amber with some reddish hues. Notes og cherries, cocoa powder, light spice and some vanilla. Gewd!

1 day old mini growler. Pours deep clear red with amber notes. No head. Aroma of honey, melted chocolate, weak Spice, vanilla, weak smoke and cherries. The taste is sweet with notes of honey, cherries, vanilla, slight barrel character, smoked chili and a mild burn the the end which stays on the palate for quite some time. Nice balance in this one.

From bottle at Dangerously Open Bottleshares. Pours a oily, clearish rusty ruby red. Aroma has vinous oaky fruits, subtle smoke, spice, cherry, chili, bourbon, heavy, sweetish amarone-ish red wine. Taste is sweet, pretty spicy, light oak, but more simple than the regular version. Light fruity acid. Oily texure with a pretty big heat.

09.04.2017, 0,375l bottle @ home:
No head, deep reddish color. Aroma is slightly rich and dry mineraly, oak, dried cherries, minerals, honey, bark, chocolate, bourbon, burnt caramel, fruit stones, grass. Taste is sweet sour-ish fruity, honey, sweet dried cherries, minerals, oak, fruit stones, mild grassy chili, bourbon, grass, dark sugar, bark, cocoa, burnt caramel. Medium bitterness, slightly sweet sticky mouthfeel with a nice warming chili burn. Lovely.

375 ml bottle poured into a snifter. The mead is a dark red. Good clarity. The aroma has big cherry skin notes with notes of boozy bourbon. Some chocolate peaks through with pepper notes. Mild prick of heat. Boozy and fruity sweet. Thick mouthfeel. Still. Delicious mead!
Bottle thanks to Stuu666. Pours clear red-brown with no head. Aromas of cherry, chocolate and chilli. Dessicated coconut. Taste is cherry, light smoky heat. Nice.

375 ml bottle on January 28, 2017. Thanks to Brian FL (non ratebeer).Clear dark red color, no head, nice thick legs. Wood, alcohol, cherries, some paint scent. Cherries, wood, alcohol, higher alcohol taste. Tongue burn chili. Cherry, chili aftertaste. Full mouthfeel, light tart finish.
Bottle at home... Deep red... Thin white lacing.. Soft peppery cherry fruits... Sweet cherries.. Big chilli... Long sweet cherry... Long tiny chocolate linger
Bottle at the December 2016 DC area cider tasting. Poured a dark ruby color, clear. Aroma was cherry notes, light chocolate, some boozy alcohol notes. Flavor was chocolate. Chili notes. Light spices.
Bottle at the RateBeer DC Cider tasting. Clear dark ruby. Aromas of whiskey, oak, berries. Tastes of cherries, oak, light cocoa, light whiskey. Light body with a dry finish.

Bottle from Cap Tap. Pours purplish brown with no head and a massive cherry and honey aroma There is a thick complex flavor that includes chocolate, cherry and honey with a huge peppery alcohol finish. Very unique and a pleasure to sip.

Sampled at a DC Gathering pours a deep, oily purple with no head. Chile in the nose, odd dragonfruit, cherry, raisin, earthy sweetness. Flavor is funny, sweet with honey but tart with raisin and cherry and star fruit, pepper too. Boozy and peppery on the finish. Interesting.
From a bottle at the RB cider tasting December 2016. Pours a clear wine color. Light smoky aroma. Flavors of pepper. Sweet finish.

Fantastic stuff. So good as to inspire my first review.

Frankly, the hint of heat, and the overall richness drive this to a level that make it "clear the shelf at any price" good.
Bottle at home. Pours deep ruby, nose is cherry, Chipotle, oak, honey, taste is fiery, juicy cherry, sweet honey. I guess some chocolate hints but tastes pretty similar to cherry Chipotle.

October 28, 2016. Bottle. 
Light hazy dark red with no head. Aroma is intense, sweet, fruity and roasted with juicy cherries, grapes, raisins, dark chocolate, light smokey chipotle notes, honey, bourbon and toffee. Taste is sweet, light sour, fruity and light chili heat. Finish is light sour with cherry skins, sweet honey, toffee, and raisin notes, light roasted dark chocolate hints, oak, smoke and light heat from the chili and alcohol. Medium to full bodied, oily and creamy texture. 
Great, everything came together very nicely in this one!

The chocolate is dominant while the cherry and chipotle are subtle, there is mild heat and a good amount of oak. You can also pick up a bit of roasted malt from the previously used barrel which I found impressive

Bottle. Pours a deep red color with a small off-white head. Has a fruity spicy woody honey aroma. Fruity spicy woody chocolate chili honey flavor. Has a sweetish spicy woody honey chili chocolate finish.

375ml bottle. Pours red in colour with no head. Nose of honey, spice, chocolate, warming. Flavour is sweet juicy, cherry, fruity, honey, red wine, with chocolate notes and a wave of hot chilli heat. Oily mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, dry & warm finish with hints of nutty peanut butter. Interesting, very sippable.
A: Deep purple coloured N: Paprika, cherries, hint of cocoa T: Smoke, cherries, chili, red cassis O: Quite exciting! Pretty hot chili to it, but not disturbing. Nice!

From bottle thanks to Brian. Aroma of cherries, some smoky chili. Clear red colour. Taste is cherry sweet, heat from chillies, alcohol sweetness, moderate sweet. Oily, smooth, sweet cherry chili finish.
pour dark red. aromas of sour cherries, marcipan and red peppers, taste medium sweet, a bit of heat, full bodied, smooth. hot and sweet aftertaste

Non Beer Trip Beer Trip Rating #75.Bottled sample at the meadery, 3/12/16. Clear dark red. Aroma of smoke, chocolate, honey. The taste is peppers, smoke, cherries, honey. Medium bodied, mild lingering spice.

Bottled. Pours clear redish amber with no head. Aroma of chocolate, wood, vanilla, dark cherry, chili and honey notes. Sweet flavor that ends up being more dry and with a chili bite. Medium bodied, oily texture and flat carbonation. An excellent an complex Meat. ðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸðŸŒŸ
Poured a still orange color. Aroma of smoled peppers, cherries, chocolate and honey, big surprise. Flavors follow suite,big pepper heat, chocolate and honey, ligbt barrel. Great stuff. âš

Pours a blood color with no head. Notes of smoke, sour cherries, vanilla, chocolate, and honey. Crazy good, this version you definitely notice the additional wood/vanilla and chocolate that rounds the mead out really well.

Bottle:
Deep purplish red, no head.
Black cherry, honey, pepper aroma.
Flavour is heavy black cherry.....very sweet.....cocoa is subdued and well done.
sweet, coupled with a very pleasing chipotle heat.
Absolutely excellent.

Bottle from Mikkeller & Friends, Copenhagen. Pours a deep red-wine-hued scarlet body, no bubbles. Aroma is honey, alcohol, cherries, vanilla and hints of cinnamon, caramelized apples and wood. Taste is cherries, chili, wood, honey, vanilla, cinnamon and hints of wine gum, caramel and red currants. Medium, slick body, faint pearly carbonation. Far too hot, but fairly tasty and fruity nevertheless, with some interesting spicy elements.
Bottle. Deep red with minimal head. Big cherry, both tart and sweet. Light underlying chocolate. Slightly pepper bite in the finish. Not much in the way of bourbon. Delicious.
Bottle. Black cherry, peppers, chocolate, honey, and dry grass aroma. Purple. Very sweet honey/black cherry, and dry red wine flavor. Light chipotle pepper burn in the finish. Delcious.
Pours the color of red wine with no head. Aroma is honey & cherry - maybe a liquor-like aroma too. Taste is oak, vanilla, cherry, honey with maybe a little hot pepper bite at the finish. Very good.

UPDATED: MAY 20, 2016 Refrigerated 375 cl blue bottle poured into a glass. Dark red.  Aroma is nice cherry, medium/thick body, and no carbonation. Taste is cherry, honey, some chocolate, some chipotle, and hints of wood. Delicious this is the best mead I have had yet.
garnet red color. nose has cherry and smokey peppers. Taste is a great balance of the cherry and smoked hipotle peppers. very little chocolate or bourbon present.

Shared with JLindros.

Poured into a Kate the Great tulip a nice deep, such garnet hue, still. Aromas of big cherry pie filling with nice smokey chipotle. Very little chocolate and bourbon. The taste is similar to the nose, Very nice sweet cherry, light tartness, good smokey chipotle. The chocolate is light, sweet, bourbon is very faint. Finish is sweet, nice but not cloy. Delicious.

Bottle @ Home, thanks Jake. A bit opaque, sort of a mahogany colored mead. Really big cherry aroma. A nice tangy fruit character. A little bit acidic, even. The chocolate works quite well with it. ThereÂ’s some chili quality on the aroma, but itÂ’s pretty light on the tongue. Well done in terms of blending in the adjuncts. A nice bit of sweet honey flavor comes through as well.

Bottle, thanks fishmich! Pours clear blood red, no head, no lacing. Aroma is cherries and honey, hints of chocolate. Flavor is quite sweet, lots of cherries, honey, hints of chili heat. Not a lot of chocolate in the flavor. Medium body, lingering sweet finish.
Bottle. Pours red with no head. Nose/taste of chocolate milk in finish with cherry, chili pepper, honey and vanilla with some cocoa towards the back of the palate - Well integrated. Medium body.

UPDATED: MAY 27, 2015 Bottle thanks to jason..Pour is red with no head...Nose is chipotle, tobacco, honey, heat, very nice fruity cherry, mustyness from the barrel? ..Taste is nice cherry and soft chocolate, alcohol, spice, honey, oak, dry, chipotle is very faint on the taste and shows some smoke and earth.

Thanks to Douglas and his camera .. . Rich honey, vanilla, cooking chocolate .. . Not getting much spice at all .. Slick full mouth and a moreish finish .. Another stellar mead from the mead kings .. . . ItÂ’s so hot my head is shriveled and clammy

Bottle thanks to Doug. Pours a clear ruby with small pink head that diminishes to nothing. The aroma is honey, cherry skin, pepper. Thick mouth, cherry, honey, light heat, very sweet, really enjoyed this.

Bottle poured a brown ruby in color with no head at all. Aroma has cherry (like the filling in those boozy cherry chocolates), chocolate, sweetness, and some hints of sherry. Mouth feel is medium light with some heat. Flavor is punchy on the cherry, big time sweet, chocolate, bits of the peppers, and cherry skins. I enjoyed this over two nights because it is so desert like and thought the second nights pour had improved.

Bouteille 375ml via trade, huge cheers to Sarro for hauling it to Belgium Thanks Kyle!
Couleur rougeÃ¢tre-acajou, dorÃ© au verre sur un filament huileux.
ArÃ´me est exceptionnel et complexe. Le tout se dÃ©veloppe sur plusieurs heures. En premier, je note surtout cette impressiond echipotle, ensuite un cÃ´tÃ© chocolat au lait et ponctuÃ© par unf ruitÃ© cerise renforcÃ©. Le tout sur une douceur mielleuse. Cette cerise tend Ã  prendr eun peu le dessus et au niveau des effluves on alterne chalaeur, fruitÃ©, chocolat et miel.
Palais est similaire. Complexe avec une chaleur des chipotle qui augmente avec la tÂ° ambiante du verre sans jamais tomber dans le surfait. A ce point, tout se complÃ©mente avec le cÃ´tÃ© chocolat ai lait qui donne son sens aux piments mais aussi Ã  la cerise. La barrique de NewHolland, sans y donner un cÃ´tÃ© biÃ¨re, donne le ton avec le cÃ´tÃ© lactose. La cerise donne ce profil lÃ©gÃ¨rement suret et cÂ’est sur toutes ses composantes que les saveurs entrechoquement pendant fort longtemps. JÂ’avoue avoir dÃ©guster un simple verre pendant 2-3 heures et cÂ’est intÃ©ressant de voir comment le tout Ã©voluÃ© avec le temps alternant entre doux, suret, boisÃ© et fruitÃ©. Au final, le profil mielleux reste en retrait et donne juste lÂ’onctuositÃ© douce de lÂ’hydromel.
Bottle from b nektar meadery Pours mostly opaque red. Taste is ch ch ch amplified From the barrel. Wonderful balance of cherry, chocolate, and chipotle
At JacobÂ’s house with group. Aroma is burning pepper, very sweet, earthy. Strong berry skins with pepper burn.

Bottle thanks to tkrjukoff. Clear red/ruby color, no head. Lovely fruity honey aroma, chocolate, vinous, grapes, raisins, raspberries, cherry, caramel notes, vanilla notes. Fruity honey flavor, cherries, wild strawberries, raspberries, honey notes, caramel, raisins, warming alcohol. Really nice.

Pour out of 375 mL bottle, dark ruby red pour with no head, very thick pour. Aroma is very interesting and caught me off guard, big wildflower honey notes into nice cherry, some cocoa powder, some slight vanilla, oak, touch of smoke in there as well. Taste is a mix of smoke, oak, slight bourbon with a hint of heat, touch of cocoa, nice honey, floral, and fruity notes with cherry, some pepper heat comes through towards the end. Pretty interesting, grows on me for sure.

Blood red, very viscous. Nose is cherry cordial, chocolate milk, rye whiskey and whipped cream. the taste is mind-blowing. very sweet, lots of tart sour cherries, pear juice, peaches and just a lot of sour. Love the whiskey bourbon taste. really great. Love it and especially since the spicy is subdued.

IÂ’m steadily falling behind. I better #bettergettodrinkingandlesstothinking. 500 mL bottle supplied by WillRunForBeer - many thanks! To tumbler, it pours a mahogany-tinted rusted red. Aromas of dark cherries, pureÃ¨d almond, coffee syrup, cough suppressant chewables, chocolate malt, blackberries, sawdust, chocolate soy milk, raspberry concentrate, blood orange, and American yeast. Tastes the same with the addition of rhubarb, unripe strawberry, cinnamon, and bourbon oak. A tinge of pepper heat, booziness, tropical fruit, and chocolate shavings experienced by swallow. Wildly better than their Cherry Chipotle. Medium-bodied, but had felt a tad light on the palate.

Sampled from a 375 ml at Willrunforbeer grand mead tasting. Dirty, hazy red color. Aroma has a cherry pie aspect with mild coca and subtle chipotle. 
Nice layering of flavor, the stout character is here and gives a nice coca/ chocolate feel to help keep the pepper at bay. Really nice smoothness in the mouthfeel. Thanks going to Brian for setting up this share, this was a real treat.

Bottle from trade, thanks umich03jm! Pours a beautiful ruby red with a brown tinge. Aroma is honey, cherry, pepper heat. CanÂ’t smell the barrel. Taste is very sweet, honey, chocolate covered cherry, bourbon and just a hint of pepper in the finish. This is fantastic!
Poured from bottle dark reddish brown. Aroma of bourbon and sweet cherries with a hint of chocolate. Taste is sweet cherry with a very mild pepper finish.

Bottle at Mikkeller&Friends - thanks to the Swedes. Clear dark red/brown - no head. Flowery. Smokey. Berries. Wooden notes. Light zesty. Cherry. Light candy. Tart notes. Chocolate finish. Lovely - light chili bite.

Bottle from umich03jm. Pours an unusual brownish maroon, with an aroma of sweet mead, cherries, and smoke--nice. Flavor is intense sweet mead, cherries and nice smokey presence. Substantial palate feel, complex and some alcohol burn. Finishes long, warming and interesting. This is a seriously good mead.

Bottle received in trade. Thank you lionsandbeer! Pours murky deep chocolate brown ruby red with no head worth mentioning but some very nice looking legs on the glass. Smell is sweet and very tiny sour with luscious dark chocolate, tart sour cherries, smoked chili, vanilla fudge, charred wood, high quality honey, hay, minerals and bourbon alcohol. Taste is slightly sweet, slightly sour, very fruity and tiny spicy with honey, high quality dark chocolate, chipotle peppers, sour cherries, vanilla, charred wood, moist soil, hay and bourbon alcohol. Mouthfeel is explosive, tart, tiny sticky sweet and near full bodied. Finish is slightly sweet, tart and fruity with dark chocolate, sour cherries, smoked chili, charred wood, moist hay, soil and bourbon alcohol. Wow! this one hits you to the ground in an explosion of flavour. Intense and very very tasty!

Bottle tnx to angst. Pours deep ruby red brownish. Aroma is bourbon sweet vanilla berry cherries a touch of chocolate. Flavor is as aroma, a very quick touch of acetic acid, alcohol, sour cherries and heat of chilies.

Poured a deep dark reddish mahogany color with aromas of booze, cherries, cacao, and light pepper. Flavors are sweet cherry juice with some light sweet bourbon and wood with light cacao and light peppery heat in the finish. Amazing in every sense of the word.

Tasting at MattÂ’s, corked bottleDark color, brown, with a red hue. Strange aroma, a bit coffeish, dusty (the chipotle); then alcohol, fruits, maybe mead. Medium sweet; weird blend of cocoa, tobacco, chocolate, fruit jam, with lightly hot finish.Appreciated because unique, yet itÂ’s well constructed, and balanced. Like drinking a black forest or another cake. Excellent.

375mL bottle, sent from northernbrews (thanks a lot, Jeff), pours a deep dark mahogany with a few tan bubbles. Aroma brings out a mesh of elements, with chipotle peppers upfront, followed by cocoa and cherry. Flavour sure is unique, with complex flavours -- bringing out luxurious notes of cocoa, cherry and a healthy chipotle burn, with just enough honey sweetness. Elegant and complex as hell. Fantastic stuff.
Bottle purchased from ChampaneÂ’s in Warren. Dark red pour with no head. Aroma of cherry, honey and some sweet booze. Cherry and honey flavor with pepper character before a tart cherry finish.

Bottle. Pours dark purple with no head. Looks a little like grape juice. Aroma is cherry juice, chipotle and a hint of chocolate. Taste comes in waves. Lots of cherry and chipotle to start with a hint of prune juice. Chocolate comes out in the finish. Not tasting the barrel at all. Medium sticky mouthfeel with no carb and a really long finish. Really excellent.

Courtesy of umich03jm
Bottle: The aroma consists of moderate cherry, lighter honey, some chipotle (probably wouldnÂ’t notice it without being told), and a touch of alcohol. It pours a dark red with minimal transparency. There are a few stray pink bubbles during the pour. The flavor starts with moderate-heavy cherry, honey, and some faint chocolate. The finish has some light chipotle with a touch of oak and alcohol. ItÂ’s medium-full with a slightly sticky mouthfeel.

Bottle: Crimson red & brown, completely still with no head. Aroma of vibrant cherry juice, sweet honey, light booze, a very mild BBQ-ish heat, & a touch of dark cacao. Taste is like sweet maraschino cherries covered in barbecue sauce & honey. Sweet, a touch spicy, & certainly fruity. A little bit of wood & some extra booze in the finish are the only signs of barrel aging. Strong cherry juice finish with lots & lots of sweet honey. Some of that chipotle spice lingers. A very tasty mead.

Vinous grape and blackberry nose. Dark maroon. Sweet cherry, blackberry, and honey. The slightest amount of heat on the back of the palate, but not distinctly chipotle. Subtle fudge finish, maybe a little bourbon. Full body, tangy, smooth. Awesome as always.

Pours from the bottle into a dark dark ruby almost hard to see the crimson without light. A really nice deep color with no head and little bubbles. The aroma is very interesting with many notes of peppers upfront mixed with an alcoholic honey all with a shy chocolate background. Flavors match the nose as initially a slight pepper hint mixed with a light chocolate flavor. Also some dark fruits sneak in. Very smooth and easy mouthfeel given the 14% abv. As soon as it hits the throat going down the spicy kick comes back at its peak. All the while a very soft feel as you would expect. It also leaves the spice on your lips well after the drink yet the chocolate flavor sticks around on the mouthfeel. Almost like drinking Cherry Chipotle with a chocolate dessert. I like how the chocolate flavors take the backseat here letting the spice and honey fruitiness take control while keeping a balance. I definitely like it. The price is a bit high but for sure worth a shot.

Awesome looking bottle shared by Alan. Poured brownish red with no head or lace as is tradition with the style. Aromas and taste are chocolate sand, cherry pie, and just a touch of chipotle. The pepper was restrained as far as body heat too. Mostly a muddy cherry chocolate bomb of honey and wood. Thanks for sharing bro.
Bottle at RyanÂ’s. Pours a deep purple brown with no head and light bubbles. Aroma is deep fruits and sugar. Mouthfeel is thick with notes of cherries, dark fruits, light spice and sugar.

Bottle. Pours a murky, muddy, opaque dark brown. Big cherry and pepper notes up front. Cherry pie with chocolate mole, booze, chipotle and honey. Very sweet up front with lots of cherry pie and honey, candied fruit, fermented cherries, chocolate, peppery spice and booze. Body is light and sticky with lingering peppery warmth. Zero carbonation but nice legs in the glass. Ends with more boozy and peppery warmth, spice and chocolate covered cherries and honey notes on the tongue. Tasty!

UPDATED: SEP 21, 2014 You can smell the peppers right away. Chipotle peppers in the taste (no heat though fortunately) with a bit of milk chocolate and slight cherry. There is a mild funk in the aftertaste.  Unfortunately, the pepper taste was just too strong on this one for me to like it.

(bottle - 375 ml) Ruby red pour with very light carbonation, Tons of flavors going on in the aroma. Lots of chocolate and cherry and you definitely get tons of the barrel. Same with the flavor. Chocolate, cherry and chipotle all mixed together with a smooth vanilla and wood flavor from the barrel. Outstanding.

Bottle pours with a clear amber to rosy red body. The aroma offers up berries and then earthy chocolate bar followed quickly by a firm chili pepper meat sensation and then more chocolate goodness. The taste runs right into deep berry richness that dries out a tad to midway. Just as I come to grips with the berry richness smooth honey sweetened chocolate surfaces, yum. This is a terrific mix of flavors but as the finish approaches IÂ’m greeted with a modest chili pepper meat note that slowly gives way to a mild warming / burn. So it ends with a warming sensation as well as juicy berry richness and chocolate. This offers up a wonderful mix of flavors and spot on flavor balance. Love it.
Pours a dark red, aroma of honey, berries and chocolate. Taste is sweet honey, berries, pepper, chocolate. Really delicious
Reddish brown pour. Great mead! Thanks to meadme. Chocolate covered cherries, light pepper flavor and mild barrel notes. Man this is good.

Bottle. The pour is a deep maroon color. The aroma is sweet cherry. The taste is sweet and tart at the same time. There is the slightest amount of heat which is perfect blend. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Red wine aroma. Incredibly complex, with flavors of tart cherries, rich dark chocolate, sweet honey, berries and a light hot pepper finish. Very smooth and medium bodied.

Multiple bottle pours at the Spring Mead Fest. Pours blood red with no carbonation. Looks sorta thick and syrupy. Really cool appearance. Aroma is rich dark cherries with chocolate, oak, and light smokey peppers. Taste blew me away. Rich, moderately sweet cherries, musty honey, and oak. The chocolate and smokey peppers show up on the back end. Just the slightest bit of heat from the peppers. Get a little tartness from the cherries too, especially when warmer. Great syrupy mouthfeel. Kinda sticky. Amazing mead that somehow improved on the already awesome Cherry Chipotle.

Bottle at Mead Fest. Brownish red color with no head. Aroma has chocolate, tart cherry and some oak. The flavor is similar to the original chocolate, cherry mead with and extra chocolate/oak kick. Starts with slightly tart cherry and honey flavor with a hint of spice. As it sits on your tongue, the smooth chocolate and oak flavors pop up. Really well done.

UPDATED: MAY 11, 2014 Pours red. Aromas of chipotle, cocoa,and minor cherry. Flavor is full on chipotle, earthy with a blast of heat. Cherry is there with a big blast of cocoa and woody character. Nice.
